body:
@iemg Thanks for your suggestion! This sounds like a useful enhancement üëç  I will forward this feature request to our product team.

For other users reading this enhancement: please upvote if you also want to have this implemented!
Agree that this is something we should fix (as a fellow European üòâ). Maybe the solution is also to adapt it based on where the viewer is coming from. Anyway, we'll keep this in mind!

a big +1. 
my client just requested if it's possible to make the week in the selector start on mondays :(
I will probably resort to implement a custom component in react for now and/or to fork streamlit to implement it...
would like to highlight that this would be really useful to at least have the option to work according to ISO standards, e.g. set Monday as the first day in a week.

issue.title: st.date_input monday as start of week

labels.name: type:enhancement
labels.description: Requests for feature enhancements or new features

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body: widget st.date_input don't have option to view Monday as first day of week.

body: Hey all! This isn't super straightforward unfortunately because the underlying BaseWeb component we use for `st.date_input` ([Datepicker](https://baseweb.design/components/datepicker/)) does not directly offer a setting for the start day in a week. We might be able to get this to work automatically though using the `locale` property. But since this is a bit more involved, it will probably take us a while until we get to it.
Yeah, I need that option for my project too, pls fix this ^^
Needed pls. I am not able to find a solution for this.
Any updates on this? We also got this requested for a Streamlit report right now.

issue.title: add a 12 hr format option to time_input

labels.name: type:enhancement
labels.description: Requests for feature enhancements or new features

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar feature requests.
- [X] I added a descriptive title and summary to this issue.

### Summary

 The current functionality of time_input appears to be hard coded to a 24 hour format (ie 14:30). It would be helpful to have an option to use a 12 hour format instead (ie 2:30pm)


### Why?

Many people are used to thinking about time in a 12 hour format. Having that functionality supported when building UIs in Streamlit will greatly improve the user experience. 

### How?

Perhaps a parameter for time_input such as "use_24hr" where its True by default but you can set it to False resulting in 12 hour functionality. 

### Additional Context

_No response_

Point # 3 - Thats what problem is...in st.date_input i pick date format in YYYY:MM:DD, but at the table i convert it to correct for my task format...
